org.tantalum.android

Class AndroidPlatformUtils.AndroidHttpConn

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tantalum.android.AndroidPlatformUtils.AndroidHttpConn
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PlatformUtils.HttpConn
    Enclosing class:
    AndroidPlatformUtils

    public static final class AndroidPlatformUtils.AndroidHttpConn
extends java.lang.Object
implements PlatformUtils.HttpConn
    A convenience class abstracting HTTP connection operations between different platforms

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AndroidPlatformUtils.AndroidHttpConn(java.lang.String url, java.util.Vector requestPropertyKeys, java.util.Vector requestPropertyValues)
      Create an Android-specific handler for HttpConnecions This is done for you when you use the HttpGetter and similar utility classes.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Close the InputStream associated with this connection.
      java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
      Get the InputStream associated with this HTTP connection
      long getLength()
      Get the length in bytes of the HTTP response body that the server will send.
      int getResponseCode()
      Get the HTTP response code returned by the server
      void getResponseHeaders(java.util.Hashtable headers)
      Get the HTTP headers returned from the server
      void setRequestProperty(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Add an HTTP header property which will be set to the server

      • getLength

        public long getLength()
        Description copied from interface: PlatformUtils.HttpConn
        Get the length in bytes of the HTTP response body that the server will send. Not all servers send this, in which case the response will be of indeterminate length.
        Specified by:
        getLength in interface PlatformUtils.HttpConn
        Returns:

      • close

        public final void close()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Close the InputStream associated with this connection. The underlying Android HTTP 1.1 connection implementation probably remains connected to the server for some time and will be re-used
        Specified by:
